$AVGO Read How Analysts Reacted To Broadcom's Q1 Results 

https://newsfilter.io/a/f35bb05a5dbb0334438e607a6e8ebea0

$AVGO Broadcom price target raised to $720 from $710 at KeyBanc 
 
KeyBanc analyst John Vinh raised the firm's price target on Broadcom to $720 from $710 and keeps an Overweight rating on the shares. Broadcom reported strong results and guidance with strength highlighted in enterprise, which is accelerating, while cloud data center demand remains strong, Vinh tells investors in a research note.

$AVGO Broadcom price target raised to $686 from $659 at Truist 
 
Truist analyst William Stein raised the firm's price target on Broadcom to $686 from $659 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The company delivered another beat and raise quarter as revenue and margin upside led to improving EBITDA and EPS, the analyst tells investors in a research note. The cycle will end at some point, but in the near-term, sales growth is re-accelerating to 20% and offers "even more confidence", Stein adds.

$AVGO Broadcom price target raised to $715 from $700 at JPMorgan 
 
JPMorgan analyst Harlan Sur raised the firm's price target on Broadcom to $715 from $700 and keeps an Overweight rating on the shares. The company delivered "solid" results and guidance, reflecting leverage to its strategic end markets and its strong product cycles, Sur tells investors in a research note. He says Broadcom's business continues to accelerate.

$AVGO Broadcom price target raised to $700 from $690 at Baird 
 
Baird analyst Tristan Gerra raised the firm's price target on Broadcom to $700 from $690 and keeps an Outperform rating on the shares. The analyst said strong demand continues and is expected to accelerate year-over-year this quarter, driven by enterprise IT, hyperscale and cloud, switches upgrades in networking, storage network connectivity, next-generation PON and DOCSYS in broadband.
